Caiques

White-bellied Caique

Similar in build to the Black-headed Caique, but with a vibrant orange or yellow head, white belly, and green wings. They are equally energetic.

Origin
Central & South America
Size
9 inches (23 cm). Weight: 150-170g (5.3-6 oz)
Weight
160g avg.
Noise Level
Moderate to Loud. Their calls can be very loud and shrill, especially when excited.

Looking for a White-bellied Caique?

See Available White-bellied Caique Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 5/10
Noise Level 9/10
Social Needs 6/10
Cuddliness 9/10

Temperament & Personality

Goofy, fearless, and always on the move. They have a reputation for being slightly more high-strung than the Black-headed variety. Very cuddly on their own terms.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Limited talking ability. They are excellent mimics of sounds and can learn many whistles.

Dietary Needs

A varied diet is key. High-quality pellets, a good mix of fresh vegetables, and a bit more fruit than other parrots to match their high energy levels.

Health & Lifespan

Can live 20-30 years. Polyomavirus can be a concern, so ensure they come from a reputable breeder. Prone to getting into trouble due to their fearless nature.

Housing Requirements

Can be suitable for apartments, but noise is a factor. A roomy cage is a must, 24"W x 24"D x 30"H at a minimum, to accommodate their acrobatic antics.

Common Questions About White-bellied Caique

What is the lifespan of a White-bellied Caique?

The White-bellied Caique typically lives for 20-30 years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the White-bellied Caique good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'intermediate' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the White-bellied Caique come from?

The White-bellied Caique is native to Central & South America.

More Caiques

Black-headed Caique

Moderate to Loud. Not as piercing as larger parrots, but they have a high-pitched, sharp call that can be frequent.
